Package application

Class EquationSolver

java.lang.Object
application.EquationSolver
public class EquationSolver extends Object
Solves an equation that is provided by the user by compartmentalizing different pieces of the equation into different tokens firstly. Next uses a stack of operators and numbers to allow for simpler computation. Has various helper methods to solve edge cases that can appear in special types of equations. Any equation that is inputted by the user that is illegal ends up being recognized as an exception. Checks for infinite loops throughout.
Author:
Eitan Tuchin

  • Method Details

    • parseEquation

      public double parseEquation(String equation, double x) throws Exception
      Tokenizes the given equation, identifies special sequences of tokens, and evaluates the expression. Checks for illegal expressions.
      Parameters:
      equation - The user inputted equation.
      x - The curent x-axis value.
      Returns:
      result The evaluated number.
      Throws:
      Exception - All possible thrown exceptions at any stage within the evaluation process.

    • identifyDecimals

      private void identifyDecimals() throws Exception
      Finds all sequences of tokens within the array that comprise a decimal number and updates the array accordingly.
      Throws:
      Exception - The index is out of bounds.

    • identifyFractions

      private void identifyFractions()
      Finds all sequences of tokens within the array that comprise a fractional number and updates the array accordingly.

    • identifyNegatives

      private void identifyNegatives()
      Finds all sequences of tokens within the array that comprise a negative number and updates the array accordingly.

    • replace

      private void replace(int index)
      Replaces token at given index with 2 or more combined tokens.
      Parameters:
      index - The given index in the token array.

    • evaluateExpression

      private double evaluateExpression() throws Exception
      Evaluates the expression by iterating through the token array and identifying each token individually. Uses helper methods to perform things like order of operations, applying operators to selected operators and operands within their respective stacks, and some other ones. Handles implicit multiplication and identifies illegal expressions.
      Returns:
      number The operand that is left at the top and bottom of the stack.
      Throws:
      Exception - An infinite loop has been detected.

    • orderOfOperations

      private void orderOfOperations(int startingPos) throws Exception
      Performs order of operations based on a given starting position within the operator stack which can be interpreted as evaluating the expression up until the the the first open parentheses is found (in most cases). Uses a priority system to first evaluate higher priority operators within the expression.
      Parameters:
      startingPos - The given starting position within the operator stack.
      Throws:
      Exception - An infinite loop has been detected.

    • numOperatorsBetween

      private int numOperatorsBetween()
      Counts the number of operators between two parentheses.
      Returns:
      count The number of operators.

    • findPosition

      private int findPosition()
      Finds the position of the first open parentheses within the operator stack.
      Returns:
      index The index of that open parentheses.

    • countParentheses

      private void countParentheses()
      Counts how many parentheses of both types that are in the expression.

    • reverseNums

      private Stack<Double> reverseNums()
      Reverses the numbers stack.
      Returns:
      retStk The reversed numbers stack.

    • isImplicitMultiplication

      private boolean isImplicitMultiplication(String currentToken, String nextToken)
      Checks for implicit multiplication between two tokens within the token array.
      Parameters:
      currentToken - The current token at index i within the evaluateExpression() method.
      nextToken - The token at index i + 1 within the evaluateExpression() method.
      Returns:
      true/false If the relationship between the two tokens holds true for this case.

    • hasPrecedence

      private boolean hasPrecedence(String op1, String op2)
      Determines if the first given operator has higher or lower priority over the second operator.
      Parameters:
      op1 - The first operator.
      op2 - The second operator.
      Returns:
      true/false Depending on op1's and op2's priorities.

    • getPriority

      private int getPriority(String operator)
      Gets the priority of the given operator using a switch.
      Parameters:
      operator - The given operator.
      Returns:
      priority An integer assigned to given operator.

    • applyOperator

      private void applyOperator(double a, double b, String operator, int index)
      Applies the operator given for the two numbers given at given index. Allows for subtraction, addition, multiplication, division, and exponentiation operations.
      Parameters:
      a - The operand to the left of the operator.
      b - The operand to the right of the operator.
      operator - The given operator.
      index - The index within the numbers stack.

    • isNumeric

      private boolean isNumeric(String str)
      Evaluates whether or not a given token is numeric or not.
      Parameters:
      str - The given token.
      Returns:
      true/false If the given string represents a number.

    • isOperator

      private boolean isOperator(String str)
      Evaluates whether or not a given token is an operator or not.
      Parameters:
      str - The given token.
      Returns:
      true/false If the given string represents an operator.

    • tokenize

      private ArrayList<String> tokenize(String expression, double x) throws Exception
      Splits the expression into tokens. Replaces all variables with the current x-axis value. Properly identifies integers with 2 or more digits. Checks for illegal expressions.
      Parameters:
      expression - The given equation.
      x - The current x-axis value.
      Returns:
      tokenList The array of tokens.
      Throws:
      Exception - An illegal character has been identified.

    • isValidInput

      private boolean isValidInput(char input)
      Checks if the user inputted a valid character into the expression or not.
      Parameters:
      input - The current character in the string expression.
      Returns:
      true/false The evaluated boolean depending on the input.
